channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Photos: Bourbon Street reopens in New Orleans after truck attack
item.description: Bourbon Street re-opened in New Orleans Thursday afternoon, more than 24 hours after Wednesday morning's attack by a Texas man driving a Ford pickup truck plowed into a crowd of New Year's revelers.
item.content:encoded:
Bourbon Street re-opened in New Orleans Thursday afternoon, more than 24 hours after Wednesday morning's attack by a Texas man driving a Ford pickup truck plowed into a crowd of New Year's revelers.

(Image credit: Halle Parker)
item.dc:creator: Halle Parker

item.title: Still on the hunt, the FBI shares new details about pipe bombs placed ahead of Jan. 6
item.description: Officials are still trying to identify the person who placed bombs outside of the Democratic National Committee and the Republican National Committee offices in 2021. Now they have fresh details.
item.content:encoded:
Officials are still trying to identify the person who placed bombs outside of the Democratic National Committee and the Republican National Committee offices in 2021. Now they have fresh details.

(Image credit: FBI)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: The oldest living Olympic medal winner, Ágnes Keleti, has died at age 103
item.description: Keleti, who was also a Holocaust survivor, was hospitalized in critical condition with pneumonia on Dec. 25. She died Thursday morning in Budapest, the Hungarian state news agency reported.
item.content:encoded:
Keleti, who was also a Holocaust survivor, was hospitalized in critical condition with pneumonia on Dec. 25. She died Thursday morning in Budapest, the Hungarian state news agency reported.

(Image credit: Laszlo Balogh)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Ukrainian soldiers and shopkeepers hold on as Russia's siege of Pokrovsk tightens
item.description: Ukrainian forces are fighting to hold on to the key city of Pokrovsk, in one of the fiercest battles in eastern Ukraine, but commanders admit the Russians have more troops and firepower.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian forces are fighting to hold on to the key city of Pokrovsk, in one of the fiercest battles in eastern Ukraine, but commanders admit the Russians have more troops and firepower.

(Image credit: Anton Shtuka for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: FBI says the suspect in the deadly New Orleans truck attack acted alone
item.description: Shamsud-Din Jabbar, the driver of the pickup truck who plowed into a crowd in New Orleans on New Year's Day, killing at least 14 people, acted alone, the FBI said Thursday.
item.content:encoded:
Shamsud-Din Jabbar, the driver of the pickup truck who plowed into a crowd in New Orleans on New Year's Day, killing at least 14 people, acted alone, the FBI said Thursday.

(Image credit: George Walker IV)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Cybertruck driver had likely self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head, sheriff says
item.description: Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Sheriff Kevin McMahill says the driver, Master Sgt. Matthew Alan Livelsberger, sustained the wound prior to the Cybertruck explosion in front of Trump's Las Vegas hotel.
item.content:encoded:
Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Sheriff Kevin McMahill says the driver, Master Sgt. Matthew Alan Livelsberger, sustained the wound prior to the Cybertruck explosion in front of Trump's Las Vegas hotel.

(Image credit: David Becker for the Washington Post)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: An Arctic outbreak will send a chill through much of the U.S. Here's how to prepare
item.description: Blasts of Arctic air are poised to bring below-average temperatures to much of the central and eastern U.S. throughout the first half of January. Here's what to expect and how to prepare.
item.content:encoded:
Blasts of Arctic air are poised to bring below-average temperatures to much of the central and eastern U.S. throughout the first half of January. Here's what to expect and how to prepare.

(Image credit: Jeff Swensen)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Biden honors Liz Cheney, Bennie Thompson with top civilian award
item.description: The pair led the congressional committee that investigated the Jan. 6 , 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol.
item.content:encoded:
The pair led the congressional committee that investigated the Jan. 6 , 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Details on the deadly attack in New Orleans. And, Amazon workers return to the office
item.description: The attack in New Orleans left at least 15 people dead and dozens more injured. Here's what we know so far about the driver who plowed through the crowd. And, Amazon workers return to the office.
item.content:encoded:
The attack in New Orleans left at least 15 people dead and dozens more injured. Here's what we know so far about the driver who plowed through the crowd. And, Amazon workers return to the office.

(Image credit: Michael DeMocker)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Dress codes for high-end restaurants may not be as strict as you think they are
item.description: Many restaurants -- even the high-end ones -- are ditching dress codes for diners.
item.content:encoded: Many restaurants -- even the high-end ones -- are ditching dress codes for diners.
item.dc:creator: Hosts
